intro: Aporosa microcalyx var. yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan aporosa, is a flowering plant native to southwestern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, while the plant produces small, dark blue fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
